author: Special Correspondent
text:
A drama being enacted to create awareness among voters in Tiruchi on Monday.— Photo: A. Muralitharan

A relay cycle rally to sensitise voters about the importance of exercising the franchise was inaugurated at Tiruverambur near here on Monday. A total of 16 cyclists participated in the event signifying the date of election which falls on May 16.

Collector K. S. Palanisamy, who flagged off the rally, said that the Election Commission has advised officials to ensure cent per cent enrolment of fresh voters with qualifying age of 18 years as on January 1, 2016.

The rally would be conducted for six days from Monday. He urged the voters to exercise their franchise without fail.

The rally culminated at the Revenue Divisional Officer’s office in Srirangam. It passed through Palpannai, Gandhi Market and Dindigul Road.

Later, the Collector addressed the proprietors of marriage halls in the city and explained the provisions of the model code of conduct. He said any suspicious booking of the hall for wooing the or utilising the venue for distributing cash or gift to voters would attract the provisions of the model code of conduct. He advised them to immediately inform the election officials of any suspicious booking of the hall.

Meanwhile, students of Cauvery College for Women staged a play at the West Taluk Office explaining the value of votes and the need to exercise the franchise.
title: Efforts to achieve cent per cent polling
